meta.homeDescription: Personal site of a backend engineer: experience, contact details, and materials on Go, Kafka, Redis, and infrastructure.
meta.materialsDescription: Courses, cheatsheets, and notes on Go, Kafka, Redis, Docker, and CI/CD for backend engineers.

materials.note: I create educational materials for backend engineers — concise cheatsheets and notes.
materials.sidebarIntro: Browse topics, filter by tags, and jump back to the right notes.
materials.introP1: This section is my living documentation for backend work: Go, messaging systems, infrastructure, CI/CD and everything around production services.
materials.introP2: Most materials started as personal notes. The focus is on real issues from real projects — from code structure and patterns to debugging and observability.
materials.introP3: Each article is meant to be self-contained: you can open it before a task, refresh the key ideas and immediately apply them in code.
materials.philosophy1: Grounded in hands-on experience and real-world problems, not purely academic examples.
materials.philosophy2: Show code and typical scenarios — what to write and why, not only high-level theory.
materials.philosophy3: Break complex topics into small, focused notes that are easy to revisit as cheatsheets.

hero.name: Eduard Gagite Stanislavovich
hero.bio:
I am a backend engineer focused on building high‑load, scalable services in Go. I design distributed systems with emphasis on efficiency, observability, and strong engineering practices.

I build server applications, integrations and APIs, work with event‑driven architectures (Kafka, RabbitMQ), and rely on Docker and CI/CD. I prefer clean, structured code based on SOLID principles and Go industry best practices.

I work with microservices, asynchronous queues, real‑time communication (gRPC, WebSocket), and optimize performance and infrastructure.

I continuously learn and explore tools and patterns, and develop side projects. I studied at Sberbank's "School 21" — intensive hands‑on training, algorithms, systems thinking, and teamwork.

promo.title: I create educational materials for backend engineers
